Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2014006264.CaseDesc: William (Bill) Kwiatek was last seen in Canmore, AB, in July, 1988. He was leaving a bar and was intending to hitchhike back to Calgary but never made it there. Mr. Kwiatek was reported missing in 2013 and very few details of when he was last seen are known.

Amputation: Left Ring Finger, partial missing finger

Case reference: 2014002695.CaseDesc: Harold Wagner was last seen on June 4, 1988, at Fur Lake in the Mont Nebo district, SK. Mr. Wagner was swimming from his boat when he disappeared.

Shorts: Cloth, White, Red, White swim trunks with red, blue and red stripes

Case reference: 2006018499.CaseDesc: Tony Gikoff was last seen July 9, 1955, near Colborne, Ontario, at a property he rented to tenants. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2022012676.CaseDesc: Sum Yee Li was last seen leaving her home in East Gwillimbury, Ontario on December 26, 2021. This is out of character for her, as she used to check in on her son on a frequent basis. She has been known to travel internationally and to Western Canada. It is believed that she was the victim of foul play due to the length of time she has been missing.

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 2005152590.CaseDesc: Helen went for a walk and did not return. At the time of her disappearance, Helen had only been in Prince George for a few weeks.

Case reference: 2014004617.CaseDesc: Richard Deren was last seen in Vancouver on March 12, 2005. He disappeared and neither his family nor friends had heard from him. This was unusual behaviour for him not to keep in contact with his friends.

Case reference: 2022065035.CaseDesc: On November 27, 2022, Alex Lawson was last seen on foot, leaving his Madeline Street apartment in Thunder Bay, Ontario.  Family have not heard from Alex since he was reported missing and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Blue, WINTER, Two tone puffy northface jacket
Scar: Abdomen, 8" wide from lower chest to pubic hair

Case reference: 2016066833.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1982, an unidentified male was discovered in the Detroit River, near Fighting Island. His post-mortem length was estimated as being between 5'6"-5'8",  however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he was in the water for no more than 6 months.

Jacket: Parka or hooded jacket, which had both a zipper and snap fasteners

Case reference: 2014004043.CaseDesc: On March 8, 2002, Eva Nakanjako, her husband Robert Mukwaya, and their son Emmanuel Mukwaya were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Eva and Robert had not shown for work for three weeks and had not paid their rent. During the time of their disappearance, their apartment was found partially emptied.

Case reference: 2020011412.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1985, Tahiya Shiekh was last seen in Scarborough, Ontario.  The family doesn't know why she left home. It is believed she left in the middle of the night while her mother and siblings were sleeping. The next morning, she was to take her younger siblings to the zoo.  It was then that the family realized she wasn't at home.

Case reference: 2014006315.CaseDesc: Julia STROBACH was last seen in her residence on Braidwood Road in Courtenay, British Columbia on October 31st, 2013 in the early evening hours.  Unfortunately, after a lengthy and comprehensive investigation police have been unable to find any trace of Julia.  Police along with Julia’s friends and family are gravely concerned for Julia's wellbeing as she has been out of contact for a year now.  It is completely out of character for Julia to be out of contact with her friends and family for so long, especially with her 3 year old son.  Police are appealing to anyone with information about Julia's movements and activities in the days and weeks leading up to October 31st, 2013, to get in touch with investigators immediately.

Hair: Brown, Dyed, Long, Often dyed red

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2023044188.CaseDesc: On August 15, 2023, Kevin Evoy was last seen leaving the Giant Tiger store in Clarence-Rockland, Ontario. He has epilepsy, no cell phone, no social media, and no other form of communication. Since Kevin rarely leaves the home, his family is concerned that he may have suffered a medical issue.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Very faded peacock tattoo

Case reference: 2013000143.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2013, Delvin D'Arcy's wife contacted the Fraser Lake RCMP to report her husband as missing. She advised them that Delvin was staying in Fort Fraser while working in the area. Delvin had contacted her on a regular basis but she has not heard from him since Feb 13, 2013.  It is believed that Mr. D'Arcy may be traveling to Ontario but he has not been heard of or seen since.

Hair: Black, White, Short, Salt and pepper grey

Case reference: 2010005899.CaseDesc: Mark Edmonson disappeared from his residence in Stoney Creek on October 3, 1999. Mr. Edmonson has not returned or contacted his family members since that time and both his family and Police are concerned for his well being. Mr. Edmonson is developmentally challenged. It is believed that Mr. Edmonson left home without taking any money or personal identification. Extensive police searches have failed to determine his whereabouts.

Pants: Blue, Jeans with hole in left knee

Case reference: 2014022293.CaseDesc: In February 1981, Emery LABOUCANE left his residence and went to work. While at work, he called his wife and stated he was on his way home. He never returned. His vehicle was later located at the Edmonton International Airport. LABOUCANE's credit cards were used in California over the course of the following month and then the usage ceased. No further activity was ever recorded on the credit cards.

Case reference: 2021022385.CaseDesc: On May 28, 2021, Kienan Tran was reported missing from his residence in West St. Paul, Manitoba. In May, a representative from property management entered Kienan’s residence and noticed that it was vacant. Additional details revealed that Kienan was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014001430.CaseDesc: On July 28, 1980, Robert Wiggins was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2016057640.CaseDesc: In the early hours of October 10, 2016, Terence Alook was last seen when he left a party at his aunt's home in the community of Desmarais, Alberta. Mr. Alook had been visiting his friends and family in the north end of Desmarais.

Other: Chin, Two moles on the lower chin

Case reference: 2012020139.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1981, 16 year old Myriam Isabelle Kniaz was seen for the last time at the residence of her foster family located in Ste-Foy, Quebec .

Case reference: 2014001323.CaseDesc: Mary Kreiser was last seen September 16, 1987, at the Petro Canada Gas station in Westlock, Alberta.  She has not been heard from since October of 1987. It is believed that Mrs. Kreiser could be in Vancouver, BC area.

Case reference: 2020048673.CaseDesc: On September 27, 2020, Geoffrey Irwin was last seen on a Royal Bank of Canada surveillance camera in Langford, British Columbia and has not been seen since. On November 25th,2020, Geoffrey Irwin's black 2017 Ford Escape was located at Park Royal Mall in West Vancouver, British Columbia. Geoffrey is known to travel between the West Shore and the Lower Mainland.

Backpack: Nylon, Black, Grey, Black with grey stripes, with zipper
Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Hooded with white drawstrings
Shorts: Synthetic, Brown, Taupe or light brown colour with pockets, size large

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2020008557.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1984, at approximately 10:00 am, Rodolf Scoulde was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Rodolf was on his way to a nearby store.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Sword and heart with the word "COCO"

Case reference: 2006013799.CaseDesc:
Katherine May Wilson was last seen on October 20, 1970, walking along Harvey Kirkland Road, in Kirkland Lake, Ontario. Extensive searches have failed to locate her.
Barry Manion was arrested on January 6, 2009, and pled guilty to murder on March 11, 2009.  He was sentenced to life in prison for her murder. Katherine's body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2014004477.CaseDesc: In June 1973, Ronald & Theresa Yakimchuk left Edmonton for a wedding in Montreal, driving their 1959 Volkswagen Beetle. It was reported the couple visited an associate in Brandon, Manitoba. They never attended the wedding. The last contact from the couple was a postcard believed to be from Theresa sent from Dryden, Ontario on June 12, 1973.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding band
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Braided, Wedding ring

Case reference: 2006020699.CaseDesc: Frank Turtle was last seen on May 12, 1994 at South Camp on Peishk Lake, near Red Lake, Ontario. His boat was found but Mr. Turtle was never found.  He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014004353.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2002 RCMP received a call reporting a missing person in the Village of Makinak. Reported missing was George Turnbull, 82 years old. George was last seen on June 22, 2002 at approximately 8:00 pm by a home care worker and was last spoken to on the phone by his son at approximately 10:00 pm that same day. The home care worker arrived at approximately 9:00 am on June 23, 2002 and noticed at that time George was not in his residence. At approximately 10:00 am the family began to search in and around the area of George's residence and farm yard. He suffers from mild dementia and has wandered off before. Volunteers continued to search for him until June 26, 2002 at which point the search was called off. George Turnbull was not seen again.

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2019070875.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2019, the remains of a woman were found in a crawl space of a triplex in Montreal, Québec.

Case reference: 2022001264.CaseDesc: On January 10, 2022, Ian Indridson was seen for the last time at his residence in Victoria, British Columbia.  Ian has not been seen or heard from since.

Shirt: Black, Blue, Eddie Bauer Brand, waffle knit, black or blue

Case reference: 2013000037.CaseDesc: On November 29, 2001, Henry Murillo Asprilla was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. On that day, he had a meeting with lawyers, which he attended with his ex-wife. After the meeting he drove his ex-wife home. Henry has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002711.CaseDesc: Sharel Haresym was reported missing September 6, 1984, he was last seen was on September 4, 1984. Mr. Haresym's vehicle was located parked on the entrance road to Twin Lakes campground near Winfield, Alberta. The vehicle was out of fuel and also had a dead battery. Mr. Haresym's clothing was located approximately 100 yards east of his vehicle. His clothing was laid out in a neat and orderly fashion with his bible alongside.

Case reference: 2012020027.CaseDesc: Maggie Lea Burke was last seen on December 9, 2004 in Edmonton, Alberta. She left her residence in the area of 118 avenue and 95 street, to go meet a friend and has not been seen since.

Hair: Brown, dyed pink purple and blond streaks at tips
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black, nose stud
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, necklace with charm
Black, Remand Centre cross on a black string

Case reference: 2006012799.CaseDesc: John Crofts last resided in a retirement home on Yearly Road in Huntsville. He was last seen in the Huntsville area on December 25, 1997.

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand
Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2014002368.CaseDesc: On June 11th, 1969, at approximately 5:50 PM, the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP received a report of an empty boat drifting in Lake Melville, in the vicinity of North West Point, North West River, NL.  Police attended and learned that this empty boat belonged to Lawrence Alton Oliver, who had been reported to have departed his residence earlier in the morning to go seal hunting.  It is believed that Mr. Oliver fell overboard while hunting and drowned.  The body of Mr. Oliver has never been located.

Boots: Rubber, Brown, Red, Rubber hip waders with a red band

Case reference: 2019040153.CaseDesc: On July 4, 2019, Shae-Lynn McAllister was seen for the last time at 10:30 pm leaving work at the A&W restaurant in Fairview, Alberta.

Case reference: 2022032399.CaseDesc: On May 25, 2022, partial skeletal remains of this man were found in a forested area near Salmon Arm, British Columbia. He had a severe fracture to his right lower leg during life, which required surgical intervention. He likely died many months to years before his remains were found.

Foreign Object: Right Leg, fracture to right tibia with surgical implant

Case reference: 2014002875.CaseDesc: Edmond Belliveau was last seen on Oct 1, 1985, in Saint John, NB.

Case reference: 2012020060.CaseDesc: Rene Mazerolle was last seen on July 28, 2008 when he was discharged from the Health Sciences Centre in Winnipeg.  Mr. Mazerolle's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014001419.CaseDesc: On December 4th, 1993 Elizabeth Mitchell was seen for the last time at her residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Her abandoned vehicle was found later that morning near Tablerock, Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Elizabeth was despondent.

Scar: Shoulders, Surgical scar on left shoulder

Case reference: 2014000022.CaseDesc: Cynthia Albena Audy was last seen getting into a vehicle in the North End area of Winnipeg, Manitoba on October 28th, 2004.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Heart and cross

Case reference: 2011005399.CaseDesc: Carol Shelleau was last seen on July 29 1988, by her children, as she was leaving her home in Sault Ste Marie, Ontario. Carol got on the back of her estranged husband's motorcycle and has not been seen since. Her estranged husband was found deceased in Vancouver in September 1988. The motorcycle involved was located in Sault Ste. Marie. Foul play is suspected.

Backpack: Green, Duffle bag containing a bathing suit
Glasses: Large and round with tinted lenses
Pants: White, With blue, pink and red stripes

Case reference: 2015012392.CaseDesc: Cuong Tu was last seen on March 11, 2015 on the south side of Edmonton, Alberta.  Cuong is described as being 5’4” tall and 124 pounds. He was last seen wearing black track pants, a black track-style jacket, and white runners.

Case reference: 2014004044.CaseDesc: Thomas Buck left his residence in St. Catherine's, Ontario, at 9am on May 30,1993. His vehicle was later located abandoned in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014000001.CaseDesc: Emma Fillipoff was last seen in the Victoria Inner Harbour area on November 28, 2012.  She was reported to be a shy and quiet person and had been staying at a local shelter for about 6 months prior to her going missing. It is believed that Emma may have been suffering from the onset of some mental health issues. She was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes.  Emma did not use or abuse drugs or alcohol.

Luggage: Canvas, Other, Light coloured canvas bag
Shoes: Blue, Grey, Was barefoot, but carrying a pair of blue or grey running shoes

Case reference: 2014005786.CaseDesc: Giuseppe Renda was last seen on May 4, 2012, at approximately 12:30 p.m., on Saint-Viateur Street West in the Plateau Mont-Royal borough of Montreal, Quebec. Giuseppe lived in the Westmount District, and was a discreet man who did not leave his home often.

Case reference: 2013000140.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1981, Rene Laflamme was last seen in Montreal, Quebec. René had visited his mother in Ottawa, Ontario and had left her residence to travel back to Montreal.

Hair: Black, Straight, recently permed black hair

Case reference: 2014030665.CaseDesc: On January 19, 1978, the partial remains of a female believed to be aged between 55-70 years of age, were found in the waters of the Salish Sea, southwest of Victoria, British Columbia. She had moderate arthritis and significant healed injuries to her left ankle and foot. It is believed she was deceased several months or even years before her remains were recovered

Case reference: 2014002824.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1985, Sidney Manning was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. On July 17, 1985, Sydney departed from Cultus Lake, B.C. in his brown 1984 Oldsmobile. On August 4, 1985, his vehicle was located abandoned on a forest service road in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014005581.CaseDesc: On March 23, 2011, at approximately 11:00 p.m., Steven Lapowich was last seen at Pearson International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Steven boarded a flight to Puerto Rico, but never returned home.

Case reference: 2006023199.CaseDesc: Kenneth Churney was last seen in March of 1997. He was on a snowmobile travelling northbound toward the trail system head at the rear of Pine Crescent. He never returned from snowmobiling and may have been suffering from mental health issues.

Deformity: Left Ring Finger, 0.5 of an inch shorter

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003189.CaseDesc: On January 15, 1986, Michel Guertin was seen for the last time in Sorel-Tracy, Quebec. Michel has not been seen or not heard from him since.

Case reference: 2021015408.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2021, Ziyue "Moses" LIU was reported missing from his family home in Surrey, British Columbia. On April 19, 2021, Moses was last seen in Coquitlam, British Columbia. He may or may not be wearing glasses.

Shoes: Black, White, Running shoes with white soles, slip on

Case reference: 2014001743.CaseDesc: On August 4, 1995, Knut Thielemann was last seen walking near the Athabasca Falls in Jasper National Park in Alberta.

Case reference: 2020008364.CaseDesc: On December 19, 1982, at approximately 10:30 am, Simon Yefronovich was seen for the last time by his friend as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Simon was scheduled to fly to Vancouver, British Columbia, with his friend, but he never boarded the flight.

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2014004908.CaseDesc: David Buckmire was last seen leaving his home in Toronto, Ontario, at approximately 12:00 p.m. on July 31, 2003.

Case reference: 2019071976.CaseDesc: In September of 2012, Donald Watson was last seen by his mother, and his family has had no contact with him since this time. Donald is transient in nature and usually travels on foot as transportation. Canada Border Services Agency’s last documentation of Donald was in 2013 when he entered Laredo, Texas in the United States from Mexico as a pedestrian.

Case reference: 2014047277.CaseDesc: On December 16, 2014, at approximately 10:30 a.m., Abdool Kisson was last seen leaving his ex-girlfriend’s house in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2022002122.CaseDesc: On January 3, 2022, at approximately 2:00 a.m., Karl Neff was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Port Colborne, Ontario. Karl has ties to the St. Catharines area in Ontario.

Case reference: 2019053661.CaseDesc:
On July 2, 1988, an unidentified man was found in the parking lot of the Value Village
on East Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had suffered from a
heart attack, and the results of his autopsy showed evidence of previous heart damage and a case of mild chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).

Case reference: 2005006599.CaseDesc:
On September 18, 1978, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Toronto Harbour of Lake Ontario. His post-mortem weight was 163lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
Staining on his teeth suggest that he may have been a smoker. It is estimated that he had been in the water for several weeks.

Teeth: Stained, Overbite & several amalgam fillings. Several teeth lost/extracted during life; lower right lateral incisor being most obvious.

Case reference: 2014003366.CaseDesc: John Groves was reported missing on July 8, 1981 from North West River, Newfoundland & Labrador.  The Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP were notified of an aluminum boat with an outboard motor going in circles  in Sheshatshiu, Labrador. Police were advised that the boat was unoccupied and travelling quite fast in circles. The investigation determined that the boat had been occupied by John Groves and it appears that he had fallen overboard and drowning was suspected. John's body of has not yet been located.

Case reference: 2016041786.CaseDesc: LeRoi La France was reported missing on March 31, 2016 when LeRoi’s siblings learned that a formal missing person report had never been made regarding their brother. He was last seen in October or November of 1964. In 1964 LeRoi was a student at UBC who lived in Burnaby BC and insured a 1952 VW Beetle.

Case reference: 2019030954.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2019, Tara Sculptor was seen for the last time by her mother on Carling Avenue in Ottawa, Ontario. It is possible that Tara took a bus from Ottawa to North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, A bald spot on the back of the head
Scar: Forehead, Severe burns to the face
Right Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Left Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Back Of Head, Skin graft removed from behind

Case reference: 2015059337.CaseDesc: On July 26, 2015, at approximately 10:30 p.m., Van Huong was last seen on vacation in Vietnam. The next morning, Van’s family noticed he had left the hotel room and had not returned.

Case reference: 2018055666.CaseDesc: On October 18, 1991, Kristina Rhodes was seen for the last time in Port Elgin, Ontario. Kristina was also known to frequent the towns of Southampton and Hanover, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020089.CaseDesc: Michel Guy Favreau lived alone in Nipawin, Saskatchewan at the time of his disappearance. Michel suffered from depression and he was last heard from and seen between September 22nd and September 25th, 2011. On October 4th, 2011 his vehicle, a 1998 green Chrysler Intrepid, was located abandoned at Carroll's Cove camp ground near Nipawin. Several searches were conducted in hopes of locating him were unsuccessful.

Case reference: 2014005265.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Devon Moldowan was seen for the last time as he left his apartment in Jasper, Alberta. It is believed that Devon left on foot, and may have been despondent during the time of his disappearance.

Pants: Black, Patches with yellow and orange stitching; baggy
Tattoo: Chest, The words "I'll keep you here for all my"

Case reference: 2006017199.CaseDesc: Mistie Murray was last seen on May 31, 1995, in the Goderich area.

Teeth: Space between her two upper front teeth

Case reference: 2014005030.CaseDesc: Wilfrid Langlois has been missing since February 5, 1998. At the time of his disappearance, it is possible that he was in the Chandler area of the Gaspé Peninsula.

Case reference: 2015069712.CaseDesc: On November 15, 2015, at approximately 1:00 p.m., Blake McCool was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000043.CaseDesc: On September 4, 2010, Jonathan Jette and Rachael Bagnall went hiking in a mountainous region north of Pemberton, B.C. They intended to spend 2 to 3 days climbing some peaks in the area. They failed to return and were reported missing. Their vehicle was located however despite an extensive search, no other trace of them has been found.

Luggage: Light Green, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 4 person tent
Sweater: Wool, Brown, White, zip up sweater (Hudson's Bay type)

Case reference: 2010000899.CaseDesc: Wilfred Bruder was last spoken to on February 28th, 2004 while talking on a pay phone at the Willow West Mall in Guelph. This mall is adjacent to the Hanlon Expressway (Hwy 6) that runs north/south through the west end of Guelph. He was depressed and said his goodbyes to his ex-wife and children.  He had a history of depression and alcholism and was drinking heavily at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014002315.CaseDesc: In 1983 Dennis Chubb moved to Winnipeg from God's Lake Narrows.  He was believed to be residing in a rooming house on Furby Street in the Downtown area of Winnipeg.  Dennis was last seen entering this rooming house after having been dropped off by a family member.  It is reported that Dennis moved from this rooming house and into another residence just prior to his disappearance. M. Chubb's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020016.CaseDesc: Rhody Lake disappeared on Sunday, November 27, 2005.  She was last seen going for a walk in Sechelt's Porpoise Bay Provincial Park located in Sechelt, B.C.

Hat: Red, Orange, Toque - might be beige

Case reference: 2014002159.CaseDesc: Jason Misurko was last known to be in Fort McMurray, Alberta on September 17, 1995. There have been no sightings or contact since then. His vehicle was later recovered in Enderby, B.C.

Case reference: 2022006110.CaseDesc: On January 24, 2022, Steven Pinch was last seen in downtown area of Calgary, AB.  Steven is known to frequent the city of Red Deer, Alberta, and the town of Rocky Mountain House, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014001578.CaseDesc: Benjamin Arsenault went missing from 172 Sydney Street, in Saint John, New Brunswick (Rooming House). Benjamin was wearing a grey suit coat.

Case reference: 2014003295.CaseDesc: Wayne Ronald Baker was reported missing on June 8, 1989 after not reporting to his shift at Phil's Restaurant in Banff, Alberta.  He was last seen by his roommate in staff accommodation the evening of June 7. Wayne Baker may have been seen in Edmonton at the Crest Hotel in July 1989.

Case reference: 2008003199.CaseDesc: Police received information that Toivo Reinikainen had not returned to work at the Great West Timber Camp on the Deadhorse Road in Walsh Twp (northern Ontario).  He had been observed on site on September 26, 1984 at 4:00 a.m. by his co-workers.  The camp location is a relatively remote area, access is by Deadhorse Road which is open to the public.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2018027693.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2018, at around 8:30 am, Diane Mae Bignell was last seen on Juniper Street in Thompson, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2014004248.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1979, at approximately 5:00 a.m., Myrna Montgrand was seen for the last time outside of a residence in La Loche, Saskatchewan. Earlier that morning, Myrna had been with a group of people at a party.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2014001482.CaseDesc: Ghislain Latour was last seen on December 9, 1982 at the Evain hotel in Evain village, which is now part of Rouyn-Noranda in the province of Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002295.CaseDesc: On July 25, 1979, James Caraley was last seen when he went mountain climbing on Mount Andromeda in Jasper, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014004610.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1967, Absolom Halkett and his colleague, James Brady, were dropped off by plane at Foster Lake, SK, which is located 120 miles north west of La Ronge, SK. The two were prospecting in the area. They were last heard from on a radio call to a nearby mine on June 8th. Extensive land, air and water searches of the area failed to locate any trace of the two men. Their camp was located but had been unused.

Case reference: 2014006211.CaseDesc: On June 29, 1978, Nick Ostashek was seen for the last time in Andrew, Alberta. Nick had recently been released from the Two Hills hospital and was despondent. His vehicle was located near the Shandro Bridge in Two Hills County, Alberta.
